w:r.w:t: Here we will discuss some conic sections. A conic section is the intersection of a plane and a cone. By changing the angle of intersection, we can produce a circle, an ellipse, a parabola or byperbola. In the special case when the plane touches the vertex, we can get a point, a line or 2 intersecting lines, a parabola, 2 parallel lines, 1 line or no curve.
A circle is the set of all points M in a place such that all points in M are equidistant to a fixed point C, the center. The distance between C and all points in M is called the radius.
